page.title: 05WORKING IN STONE CRESSBROOK
page.content: {STONE CUTTING at CRESSBROOK MILL.} Sand-stone from Stancliffe Quarry arrives at the mill in 5-8 ton blocks. There are 2 specialist cutters and 5 labourers employed.There are 4 cutting machines and 2 splitters.The stone is cut into building blocks and ashlar blocks.Most stone is cut to order and used for both interior and exterior work,60% is used locally,the rest sent countrywide. {DRY STONE WALLING }where no mortar is used is a very skilled job.The largest stones are used at the base,the middle filled with small ones,and coping stones on top keep out the rain and hold the tapered-shaped wall together.A man can build 3-4 metres per day at a cost of Â£5-Â£10 per metre. Progress depends upon the size of the limestone available from the nearby fields and quarries.
